User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user in the application.

profilePhoto.description: URL of the user's profile photo.

followers.description: References to Users who are following this user. (Relationship: User N:N User)

following.description: References to Users who this user is following. (Relationship: User N:N User)

createdAt.description: Timestamp of when the user was created.

verified.description: Indicates if the user's account is verified.

Post.title: Post
Post.description: Represents a post in the application.

location.description: Location where the post was taken.

likes.description: References to Users who liked this post. (Relationship: User N:N Post)

commentsCount.description: Number of comments on the post.

createdAt.description: Timestamp of when the post was created.

Story.title: Story
Story.description: Represents a story in the application.

mediaUrl.description: URL of the story's media (image or video).

type.description: Type of the story media (image or video).

createdAt.description: Timestamp of when the story was created.

expiresAt.description: Timestamp of when the story expires.

Highlight.title: Highlight
Highlight.description: Represents a collection of stories as a profile highlight.

userId.description: Reference to User who owns this highlight.

coverImage.description: URL of the cover image for the highlight.

storyIds.description: An array of story IDs included in this highlight.

createdAt.description: Timestamp of when the highlight was created.

SavedPost.title: SavedPost
SavedPost.description: Represents a reference to a post saved by a user.

postId.description: The ID of the saved post, referencing the 'posts' collection.

savedAt.description: Timestamp of when the post was saved.

Reel.title: Reel
Reel.description: Represents a reel in the application.

likes.description: References to Users who liked this reel. (Relationship: User N:N Reel)

commentsCount.description: Number of comments on the reel.

createdAt.description: Timestamp of when the reel was created.

Comment.title: Comment
Comment.description: Represents a comment on a post or reel.

parentId.description: Reference to Post or Reel to which the comment belongs.

userId.description: Reference to User who wrote the comment. (Relationship: User 1:N Comment)

createdAt.description: Timestamp of when the comment was created.

Chat.title: Chat
Chat.description: Represents a chat between two users.

users.description: References to Users participating in the chat. (Relationship: User N:N Chat)

Message.title: Message
Message.description: Represents a message within a chat.

chatId.description: Reference to Chat to which the message belongs. (Relationship: Chat 1:N Message)

senderId.description: Reference to User who sent the message. (Relationship: User 1:N Message)

text.description: Text content of the message.  If mediaUrl is populated, this will contain the AI generated caption.

mediaUrl.description: URL of the message's media (image or video), can be null.

timestamp.description: Timestamp of when the message was sent.

isRead.description: Indicates if the message has been read.

Call.title: Call
Call.description: Represents a call between two users.

callerId.description: Reference to User who initiated the call. (Relationship: User 1:N Call)

receiverId.description: Reference to User who received the call. (Relationship: User 1:N Call)

isLive.description: Indicates if the stream is currently live.

Category.title: Category
Category.description: Represents a content category for streams.

thumbnailUrl.description: URL for the category's box art.

Video.title: Video
Video.description: Represents a long-form video, like on YouTube.

views.description: Number of times the video has been viewed.

likes.description: Number of likes the video has received.

createdAt.description: Timestamp of when the video was published.

VideoComment.title: Video Comment
VideoComment.description: Represents a comment on a long-form video.

createdAt.description: Timestamp of when the comment was posted.

LiveChatMessage.title: Live Chat Message
LiveChatMessage.description: Represents a message within a live stream chat.

userId.description: The ID of the user who sent the message.

username.description: The username of the user who sent the message.

text.description: The content of the chat message.

timestamp.description: Timestamp of when the message was sent.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore data structure is designed to create a scalable and secure Instagram-like application, named YC, prioritizing authorization independence, clarity, and ease of maintenance. The structure segregates data based on access patterns and uses denormalization to avoid complex security rules using `get()` calls. 

*   **users/{userId}:**  Path-based ownership ensures only the user can modify their profile. Includes core profile information (username, email, bio, profilePhoto, followers, following, createdAt, verified).
*   **posts/{postId}:**  Each post is stored in a top-level collection. `userId` indicates ownership. This approach facilitates listing all posts, potentially filtered by user. Includes: userId, imageUrl, caption, location, likes(array), commentsCount, createdAt.  Security rules will enforce that a user can only write posts with their own `userId`.
*   **stories/{storyId}:**  Each story is stored in a top-level collection to facilitate listing and querying based on expiration (`expiresAt`). The `userId` field denotes ownership. Includes userId, mediaUrl, type(image/video), createdAt, expiresAt.
*   **users/{userId}/highlights/{highlightId}:** Stores story highlights as a subcollection under the user, which simplifies security rules. `userId` indicates ownership. Includes title, coverImage, and an array of `storyIds`.
*   **users/{userId}/savedPosts/{savedPostId}:** Stores references to posts saved by a user. Nesting under the user path (`users/{userId}`) provides a clear and secure way to manage saved posts, ensuring that only the owner can access their own saved items.
*   **reels/{reelId}:** Each reel is stored in a top-level collection to facilitate listing and querying. `userId` indicates ownership. Includes userId, videoUrl, thumbnailUrl, likes(array), commentsCount, createdAt. Security rules will enforce that a user can only write reels with their own `userId`.
*   **comments/{commentId}:** Each comment is stored in a top-level collection, simplifying queries across posts and reels. `parentId` references either a `postId` or `reelId`.  The `userId` field indicates the comment's author. Includes parentId(postId or reelId), userId, text, createdAt.
*   **chats/{chatId}:** Represents a chat between two users. The `users` array contains the UIDs of the participants. Includes users: [userId1, userId2].
*   **chats/{chatId}/messages/{messageId}:** Subcollection of `chats`. Each message contains `senderId`, `text` or `mediaUrl`, `timestamp`, and `isRead`.  Authorization rules will ensure only participants can read messages.
*   **calls/{callId}:**  Each document stores call metadata for WebRTC signaling, including `callerId`, `receiverId`, SDP `offer`, and `answer`. Security rules restrict access to the caller and receiver to ensure signaling is private.
*   **streams/{streamId} & categories/{categoryId}**: Added collections for the live-streaming feature. `streams` will be publicly readable, but write access will be restricted to the streamer. `categories` will be public and read-only for clients. A `live-chat-messages` subcollection is added to `streams` to store chat messages, which will be publicly readable but writable only by authenticated users.
*   **videos/{videoId}**: Added for the YouTube-like feature. This collection will store all long-form videos and will be publicly readable. A `comments` subcollection is added for video-specific comments.

**Authorization Independence (Denormalization):**

*   The structure avoids `get()` calls in security rules by denormalizing authorization data.  For example, the `posts`, `stories`, `reels`, and `comments` collections all include the `userId` which allow rules to authorize create/update operations based on `request.auth.uid == resource.data.userId`. For chats, a user must be in the `users` array to read/write messages in that chat.

**Query and List Security (QAPs):**

*   The segregation of data into distinct collections (e.g., separating posts and reels) allows for simple `list` operations with straightforward security rules (e.g., `allow read: if request.auth != null`).
*   The `users` array in `chats` enables secure listing of chats for a specific user (rule: `request.auth.uid in resource.data.users`).

This structure adheres to the core design principles by:

*   Enabling authorization independence through denormalization.
*   Providing clarity of intent through a well-defined, predictable schema.
*   Avoiding custom claims (DBAC) and relying on `request.auth.uid`.
*   Supporting secure `list` operations (QAPs) via structural segregation and membership maps.
*   Facilitating the enforcement of data invariants such as ownership and timestamps.
